title: Explicit Instruction Strategy After Problem-Solving for Optimizing Motor Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic principles of exercise biomechanics and physical education experience
context.additional_context: Aims for in-service science teachers and coaches to acquire motor learning methodologies applicable to actual physical education classes.

learning_goals: Applying the PS-I (Problem-Solving followed by Explicit Instruction) strategy improves learners' throwing distance by over 15%
Achieve an 80% accuracy rate in correctly performing at least three technical elements (elbow angle, foot placement sequence, etc.)
Cultivate self-directed learning abilities through peer feedback and video analysis tools in blended environments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
